prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: My assistant and a disciple in the Kurain Tradition of spirit channeling.
Character 1
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Maya's older sister and my eternal mentor in life and law. Passed away 2 years ago. She was the attorney when Dahlia Hawthorne was sentenced to death. 
Character 2
Name: Godot
Description: A prosecutor who is shrouded in mystery. He seems to know me somehow.
Character 3
Name: Pearl Fey
Description: Maya's cousin, and channeling prodigy. She has amazingly powerful spiritual abilities.
Character 4
Name: Bikini
Description: A hearty, motherly nun at Hazakura Temple, a channeling dojo deep in the mountains.
Character 5
Name: Elise Deauxnim
Description: Kind-eyed author and illustrator of picture books. Pearls is huge fan of hers.
Character 6
Name: Iris
Description: A nun at Hazakura Temple. She reminds me so much of "her"...
Character 7
Name: Laurice Deauxnim* (when playing as Wright) → Larry Butz* (when playing as Edgeworth)
Description: Better known as Larry Butz. Current in training as Elise Deauxnim's pupil.
Character 8
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: My friend since grade school. Fell from Dusky Bridge and is currently hospitalized.
Character 9
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 10
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: My mentor, Manfred von Karma's, daughter. Born/raised in Germany. Prosecutor at 13.
Character 11
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: An old friend. Said to be #1 at the D.A.'s office. Studies foreign judicial systems now.
Character 12
Name: Morgan Fey
Description: Older sister of Misty Fey and mother of Pearl and Iris. Is in solitary confinement.
Character 13
Name: ?????? → Dahlia Hawthorne
Description: Morgan Fey's daughter and Iris's twin sister. Her father deals in jewelry apparently.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.* (when playing as Wright) Received from Wright. He wasn't serious when he gave this to me... was he?* (when playing as Edgeworth)
Evidence 1
Name: Magatama
Description: A present from Maya. It reacts to people who have secrets in their hearts.* (when playing as Wright) Received from Wright. Something about reading people's hearts... What utter nonsense.* (when playing as Edgeworth)
Evidence 2
Name: Oh! Cult! New Year's Issue
Description: An occult magazine featuring Hazakura Temple. Click here for details.
Evidence 3
Name: Hazakura Temple Map
Description: Shows Hazakura Temple and the surrounding area. Click here for details.
Evidence 4
Name: Hanging Scroll
Description: Shows Misty Fey, Master of the Kurain Technique. Click here for details. Misty Fey's image is obscured by gravy. Godot described her as 'clad in her stunning Japanese garb surrounded by the hue and aroma of Western tastes'.
Evidence 5
Name: Photo of Elise
Description: Taken by her only pupil, Laurice Deauxnim. Click here for details.
Evidence 6
Name: Iris's Hood
Description: A magical hood said to offer protection from evil spirits. Received before the lights out bell the night of the crime. Protects from evil spirits.
Evidence 7
Name: Weather Data
Description: A regional weather report for the night of the crime.
Eagle Mountain Weather Data for Feb. 07
Snow, with occasional lightning strikes.

Snow: 7 to approx. 10:50 PM
Lightning: 10 to approx. 11 PM

Lightning struck Dusky Bridge at 10:45.
Around 30 minutes passed between
the fire starting and going out.
Evidence 8
Name: Note to Iris
Description: Found in the Main Hall. Maybe she dropped it? Click here for details.
Evidence 9
Name: Victim's Staff
Description: Carried by Elise Deauxnim when she was alive. Has her fingerprints on it. Has a sword hidden inside. No one knows this except Detective Gumshoe and I. Has a sword hidden inside. The actual weapon used to murder the victim.
Evidence 10
Name: Shichishito
Description: The apparent murder weapon. Had the victim's blood and the suspect's fingerprints on it. Had the victim's blood and the suspect's fingerprints on it, but is not the murder weapon.
Evidence 11
Name: Elise's Autopsy Report
Description: Time: 10 - 11 PM. Cause: loss of blood from stab in back. Body fell 10 ft. after death.
Evidence 12
Name: Iris's Testimony
Description: Rang lights out bell at 10 PM and was then in her room until the murder was discovered.
Evidence 13
Name: Crime Photo
Description: The courtyard where Elise Deauxnim was murdered. Click here for details.
Evidence 14
Name: Tracks Photo
Description: Taken that night. From Main Gate to Dusky Bridge. Click here for details.
Evidence 15
Name: Larry's Sketch
Description: Horrible sketch of what he saw the night of the crime. A bridge is on fire. There are two draw strings slanted above the bridge. A sihouette is seen gliding over the bridge. 
Evidence 16
Name: Crystal Sphere
Description: Found half-covered in snow near Dusky Bridge the night of the crime. Has blood on it. Found on outcropping near Dusky Bridge. Has blood on it. Came from the victim's staff.
Evidence 17
Name: Kurain Master's Talisman
Description: Worn by Elise Deauxnim. Found in the garden of the Inner Temple.
Evidence 18
Name: Burnt Letter
Description: Found by Gumshoe in the Inner Temple incinerator. Click here for details. Orders from Morgan Fey. Opened once before. Click here for details.
Evidence 19
Name: Dagger
Description: Found behind a tree in the Inner Temple garden. The blood is being analyzed now. Found stuck in a pine tree in Inner Temple Garden. The blood doesn't match the victim's.
Evidence 20
Name: Stone Lantern
Description: A lantern from the Inner Temple garden. Was not lit the night of the crime.
Evidence 21
Name: Dusky Bridge Photo
Description: Taken the morning after the crime. Click here for details.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I went to the Inner Temple that night and I saw it all happen in the garden.
Person: Iris
Testimony 1
Testimony: I saw Mystic Elise strike Mystic Maya with her staff!
Person: Iris
Testimony 2
Testimony: While Mystic Maya was still stumbling, Mystic Elise moved in to deliver a fatal strike!
Person: Iris
Testimony 3
Testimony: She threw her staff away and pulled a dagger from inside her robe!
Person: Iris
Testimony 4
Testimony: Mystic Maya tried desperately to defend herself and stole the weapon...!
Person: Iris
Testimony 5
Testimony: It was only in self-defense! You can't blame her for it!
Person: Iris

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem step by step. The user wants to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The characters, evidences, and testimonies are all given, so I need to cross-reference them to find inconsistencies.

First, let's look at the testimonies provided by Iris. Testimony 0 says she went to the Inner Temple and saw everything happen in the garden. Then, in Testimonies 1 to 5, she describes the fight between Mystic Elise and Mystic Maya. Specifically, Testimony 3 states that Elise threw her staff away and pulled a dagger from her robe. 

Now, looking at the evidences related to the murder weapon. Evidence 9 is the Victim's Staff, which mentions that the staff actually has a sword hidden inside and is the real murder weapon. However, Evidence 10, the Shichishito, is described as the apparent murder weapon with the victim's blood and suspect's fingerprints, but it's noted that it's not the actual weapon. Also, Evidence 19 is a dagger found in the garden with blood that doesn't match the victim's. 

The contradiction here is in Testimony 3 where Iris claims that Elise used a dagger pulled from her robe. However, according to Evidence 9, the staff itself was the actual murder weapon (containing a hidden sword). Since the staff's sword was used, the mention of a dagger being used instead contradicts this. Moreover, the dagger found (Evidence 19) doesn't have the victim's blood, so it wasn't the murder weapon. Therefore, Iris's Testimony 3 about the dagger is contradicted by Evidence 9 and 10 which point to the staff's hidden sword as the real weapon.

cot:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. Let me start by going through each testimony and checking the evidence for contradictions.

Testimony 3 from Iris says that Mystic Maya stabbed Mystic Elise with the knife. But looking at the evidence, Evidence 9 is the victim's staff, which actually has a hidden sword. The autopsy report (Evidence 11) says the cause of death was a stab wound in the back from the staff's sword, not a knife. Also, Evidence 10 is the Shichishito, which was thought to be the murder weapon but isn't. The real weapon is the staff's sword. So Iris's testimony claims Maya used the knife (Shichishito?), but the evidence shows the actual murder weapon was the staff's hidden sword. That's a contradiction.

Person: Iris

Testimony 6
Testimony: By the time the murder took place, the snow had already stopped.

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's try to figure this out. I need to find which evidence contradicts one of the testimonies provided. Let's start by going through each testimony and checking against the evidence.

Looking at Testimony 6 from Iris: "By the time the murder took place, the snow had already stopped." The murder happened between 10 and 11 PM according to the autopsy report (Evidence 11). Now, checking the Weather Data (Evidence 7), it says snow was from 7 PM to approximately 10:50 PM. So if the murder was around 10:45 PM (when lightning struck the bridge), the snow would have been ongoing until 10:50. But Iris claims the snow had already stopped when the murder took place. However, the murder's time is between 10-11 PM. If the murder occurred after 10:50, the snow would have stopped, but if it was before 10:50, it was still snowing. The testimony says the snow had stopped by the time of the murder. But the weather data shows snow ended around 10:50, and the lightning was until 11 PM. Bikini's testimony in the weather data says she saw the murder around 11 PM. Wait, but the autopsy report says time of death was 10-11 PM, so the exact time isn't pinpointed. So if the murder was at 11 PM, then the snow had stopped by 10:50, which would align with Iris's testimony. Hmm, maybe not a contradiction here. Let me check another angle.

Looking at Testimony 3: "I dragged it behind me all the way across Dusky Bridge." The bridge was struck by lightning at 10:45 PM (Evidence 7), which probably caused the fire. The tracks photo (Evidence 14) shows tracks from the Main Gate to Dusky Bridge. If the bridge was on fire after the lightning strike, dragging a body across it might not be possible. Also, Larry's Sketch (Evidence 15) shows the bridge on fire with a silhouette. If Iris dragged the body across the bridge after the fire started (around 10:45), the bridge might have been burning, making it impossible. But according to her Testimony 4, she used the snowmobile after crossing the bridge. Wait, the weather data also mentions that around 30 minutes passed between the fire starting and going out. So the fire started at 10:45, then lasted 30 minutes, ending around 11:15. If the murder happened at 11 PM (as per Bikini), then Iris moving the body after 11 PM would mean the bridge was on fire. But she says she dragged the body across Dusky Bridge. That seems contradictory because the bridge would be on fire. So maybe Evidence 14 (Tracks Photo) shows tracks leading to the bridge, but if the bridge was on fire, how could she cross? Or maybe the tracks were made before the fire? Alternatively, the Crystal Sphere (Evidence 16) was found near the bridge, which had blood. If the bridge was burning, dragging a body across would be impossible. Hmm. Alternatively, Testimony 3 says she dragged the body across the bridge, but the bridge was struck by lightning at 10:45, so if she did that after the strike, the bridge might have been damaged or on fire, making it impossible. Therefore, the testimony about crossing the bridge after the lightning strike (which caused the fire) contradicts the fact that the bridge was on fire. So Evidence 7 (Weather Data) states the lightning struck the bridge at 10:45, which started the fire. If Iris dragged the body across after that time, the bridge would be on fire, making it impossible. But in Testimony 3, she says she dragged the body across Dusky Bridge. That's a contradiction. Therefore, the evidence is 7 and testimony is 3. Wait, but let's confirm. The Weather Data says lightning struck at 10:45 PM, causing the fire, which took about 30 minutes to go out. So from 10:45 to around 11:15, the bridge was on fire. The murder happened between 10 and 11 PM. If the body was moved after 10:45, the bridge would be on fire. So Iris's Testimony 3 about crossing the bridge while dragging the body would conflict with the bridge being on fire. Therefore, the evidence (7) shows the bridge was on fire from 10:45, and her testimony says she dragged the body across, which is impossible. So the contradiction is between Testimony 3 and Evidence 7. Therefore, the answer should be {"evidence": 7, "testimony": 3}.

Lightning: 10 to approx. 11 PM

Around 30 minutes passed between
the fire starting and going out.
Evidence 8
Name: Note to Iris
Description: Found in the Main Hall. Maybe she dropped it? Click here for details.
Evidence 9
Name: Victim's Staff
Description: Carried by Elise Deauxnim when she was alive. Has her fingerprints on it. Has a sword hidden inside. No one knows this except Detective Gumshoe and I. Has a sword hidden inside. The actual weapon used to murder the victim.
Evidence 10
Name: Shichishito
Description: The apparent murder weapon. Had the victim's blood and the suspect's fingerprints on it. Had the victim's blood and the suspect's fingerprints on it, but is not the murder weapon.
Evidence 11
Name: Elise's Autopsy Report
Description: Time: 10 - 11 PM. Cause: loss of blood from stab in back. Body fell 10 ft. after death.
Evidence 12
Name: Iris's Testimony
Description: Rang lights out bell at 10 PM and was then in her room until the murder was discovered.
Evidence 13
Name: Crime Photo
Description: The courtyard where Elise Deauxnim was murdered. Click here for details.
Evidence 14
Name: Tracks Photo
Description: Taken that night. From Main Gate to Dusky Bridge. Click here for details.
Evidence 15
Name: Larry's Sketch
Description: Horrible sketch of what he saw the night of the crime. A bridge is on fire. There are two draw strings slanted above the bridge. A sihouette is seen gliding over the bridge. 
Evidence 16
Name: Crystal Sphere
Description: Found half-covered in snow near Dusky Bridge the night of the crime. Has blood on it. Found on outcropping near Dusky Bridge. Has blood on it. Came from the victim's staff.
Evidence 17
Name: Kurain Master's Talisman
Description: Worn by Elise Deauxnim. Found in the garden of the Inner Temple.
Evidence 18
Name: Burnt Letter
Description: Found by Gumshoe in the Inner Temple incinerator. Click here for details. Orders from Morgan Fey. Opened once before. Click here for details.
Evidence 19
Name: Dagger
Description: Found behind a tree in the Inner Temple garden. The blood is being analyzed now. Found stuck in a pine tree in Inner Temple Garden. The blood doesn't match the victim's.
Evidence 20
Name: Stone Lantern
Description: A lantern from the Inner Temple garden. Was not lit the night of the crime.
Evidence 21
Name: Dusky Bridge Photo
Description: Taken the morning after the crime. Click here for details.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I was passing through the garden on the way to a spare prep room when it happened.
Person: Maya
Testimony 1
Testimony: Suddenly, someone struck me over the head...
Person: Maya
Testimony 2
Testimony: I stumbled... and ended up against the stone lantern.
Person: Maya
Testimony 3
Testimony: I think I screamed, "Help me!"
Person: Maya
Testimony 4
Testimony: I could see a man behind my attacker by the light of the stone lantern.
Person: Maya
Testimony 5
Testimony: Then something warm splashed over me...
Person: Maya
Testimony 6
Testimony: That's when... I lost consciousness.
Person: Maya

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence contradicts one of the testimonies provided. The characters, evidences, and testimonies are all given here. Let me start by going through the testimonies first, particularly Maya's testimonies since all the testimonies listed are from her.

Looking at Testimony 4: "I could see a man behind my attacker by the light of the stone lantern." Maya says she saw a man behind her attacker because the stone lantern was lit, providing light. Now, checking the evidence related to the stone lantern. Evidence 20 is the Stone Lantern, and its description says "Was not lit the night of the crime." If the stone lantern wasn't lit, then Maya couldn't have seen the man by its light. That directly contradicts her testimony. That seems like a clear contradiction. 

Wait, let me double-check. Evidence 20 states the lantern was not lit. Testimony 4 claims she saw the man by the light of the stone lantern. If the lantern wasn't lit, there's no light, so she couldn't have seen the man. That's a solid contradiction. So the pair would be Evidence 20 and Testimony 4. But let me check if there are any other possible contradictions. 

Looking at other testimonies: Testimony 3 says she screamed "Help me!" and Testimony 5 mentions something warm splashing over her. The warm splash might relate to blood, but which evidence contradicts that? The autopsy report (Evidence 11) says the cause was loss of blood from a stab in the back. The warm splash could be blood, but I don't see a direct contradiction here. 

Another angle: Testimony 4's mention of the stone lantern being lit versus Evidence 20 stating it wasn't lit. That's a direct conflict. So the correct answer should be Evidence 20 and Testimony 4.

cot:
Okay, let's try to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other. I need to look through the provided testimonies and evidences to find a contradiction.

First, let's look at the testimonies. All of them are from Maya. Testimony 3 says, "The torches were lit... And the body was gone." So Maya is saying that when she came back to the garden, the torches were lit, and Elise's body was no longer there. But according to the autopsy report (Evidence 11), the body fell 10 feet after death. That might not directly contradict, though.

Wait, let's check the weather data (Evidence 7). It mentions that there was snow until around 10:50 PM and lightning until 11 PM. The lightning struck Dusky Bridge at 10:45. Also, the tracks photo (Evidence 14) shows tracks from the Main Gate to Dusky Bridge. But how does this relate to the testimonies?

Testimony 4 says that all the snow around the stone lantern had been cleaned up. But the stone lantern (Evidence 20) wasn't lit that night. If the snow around it was cleaned up, maybe someone tried to hide something. But how does that contradict?

Looking at Larry's Sketch (Evidence 15), he drew a bridge on fire with two draw strings and a silhouette. The bridge that was struck by lightning was Dusky Bridge, which caught fire. But the crime photo (Evidence 13) is of the courtyard where Elise was murdered. Hmm.

Testimony 3 mentions the torches were lit. But Evidence 20 (Stone Lantern) states it was not lit that night. Wait, but the stone lantern is in the garden. Wait, Testimony 3 says the torches were lit and the body was gone. However, the autopsy report (Evidence 11) says the body fell 10 feet after death. So the bridge fire would have been from 10:45 to around 11:15 PM. If the body was moved, but the torches in the garden were lit after the snow stopped (which was around 10:50 PM), maybe there's a timing issue.

Alternatively, let's check Testimony 4: "And all of the snow around the stone lantern had been carefully cleaned up, too." The Stone Lantern (Evidence 20) wasn't lit. If the snow was cleaned up around it, but the lantern wasn't lit, maybe the snow shouldn't have been there if the lantern was lit. But the testimony says the snow was cleaned up, which would make sense if someone wanted to hide something. However, the contradiction might be elsewhere.

Wait, Testimony 4 says the snow was cleaned up around the stone lantern, but Evidence 20 says the stone lantern wasn't lit. If the snow was cleaned up, maybe someone lit the lantern afterwards, but the evidence says it wasn't lit. Or perhaps the weather data shows that it was snowing until 10:50 PM. If the snow was cleaned up after the snow stopped (after 10:50), there would be tracks or new snow. But the tracks photo (Evidence 14) shows tracks to Dusky Bridge, which might be related to the bridge fire. Not sure.

Another angle: Testimony 5 says Maya assumed the killer was a man because they did all the work alone. But maybe one of the evidences contradicts that. For example, if a female character could have done it alone, but that's not direct.

Wait, the Shichishito (Evidence 10) is the apparent murder weapon but isn't the actual one. The real weapon is the staff (Evidence 9) with a hidden sword. Looking back, Testimony 3: The torches were lit. If the stone lantern (Evidence 20) in the garden wasn't lit, but the torches (maybe other lights) were lit. Not sure if that's a contradiction. Alternatively, maybe the hanging scroll (Evidence 4) mentions Misty Fey's image obscured by gravy. Not sure.

Wait, the weather data (Evidence 7) says there was lightning until 11 PM. The tracks photo (Evidence 14) shows tracks leading to Dusky Bridge, which was struck by lightning. Larry's Sketch (Evidence 15) shows the bridge on fire with a silhouette. The fire started at 10:45 and lasted 30 minutes, so until around 11:15 PM. The autopsy report (Evidence 11) says the time of death was between 10 and 11 PM. The body fell 10 feet after death.

If Maya's Testimony 3 says that when she came back, the torches were lit and the body was gone, but the body fell 10 feet after death, which would mean the body was moved. However, how does that contradict with evidence?

Wait, let's check Testimony 3 again: "The torches were lit... And the body was gone." The torches being lit might relate to the time. The weather data says the snow stopped around 10:50 PM. If the torches were lit after the snow stopped, perhaps. But the bridge fire was from 10:45 to 11:15. Maybe the torches being lit contradicts the fact that the stone lantern (Evidence 20) wasn't lit. Wait, the stone lantern is part of the garden. If the stone lantern wasn't lit, but other torches were, that's possible. So maybe no contradiction there.

Alternatively, the burnt letter (Evidence 18) is orders from Morgan Fey. If Morgan is in confinement, perhaps she ordered someone to do something. But how does that relate to the testimonies?

Wait, let's consider Testimony 0: Maya came to on the Training Hall floor. Then Testimony 1: When she got back to the garden, it had changed. Testimony 3 and 4 talk about the torches lit and snow cleaned up. The contradiction might be between the cleaned snow (Testimony 4) and the weather data. The snow stopped at 10:50 PM. If the snow around the lantern was cleaned up after that, but the tracks photo (Evidence 14) shows tracks from the Main Gate to Dusky Bridge. If someone cleaned the snow around the lantern, maybe new snow would have covered it again if the snow was still falling. Wait, the snow stopped at 10:50. So after 10:50, no more snow. So if the killer cleaned the snow after 10:50, there would be no new snow to cover the tracks. But the tracks photo shows tracks leading to Dusky Bridge. However, the Tracks Photo (Evidence 14) is from that night, so maybe the tracks were made during the snowfall, which would have been covered unless they were made after the snow stopped. But I'm not sure.

Alternatively, Testimony 4 says the snow around the stone lantern was cleaned up. But the Stone Lantern (Evidence 20) wasn't lit. If the snow was cleaned up, perhaps the lantern was supposed to be lit, but it wasn't. But that's not a direct contradiction. Hmm.

Another angle: The Crystal Sphere (Evidence 16) was found near Dusky Bridge with blood. It came from the victim's staff (Evidence 9). The staff had a hidden sword. The victim was stabbed with the staff's sword, and the Shichishito (Evidence 10) was a fake weapon. The real murder weapon is the staff. So maybe the Shichishito's presence contradicts someone's testimony, but the testimonies here are all from Maya.

Wait, Testimony 2: Maya thinks the killer cleaned up evidence for her sake. But if the killer left the Shichishito with their fingerprints, that would be incriminating, not cleaning up. However, the Shichishito is a fake weapon, so the killer might have planted it. But that's more of a red herring than a direct contradiction.

Looking back, the key might be in Testimony 3 where Maya says the torches were lit and the body was gone. The autopsy report (Evidence 11) states the body fell 10 feet after death. If the body was moved after death (fell 10 ft), then perhaps the body was moved to where it fell, but Maya found it gone. Alternatively, let's look at the Weather Data (Evidence 7): Snow stopped at 10:50 PM. The tracks photo (Evidence 14) shows tracks from Main Gate to Dusky Bridge. But the photo was taken that night. Wait, the snow stopped at 10:50, and the lightning was until 11 PM. The tracks photo would show tracks made after the snow stopped, which would not be covered. But how does that relate to the testimonies?

Hmm, perhaps Testimony 4 (snow cleaned around the lantern) and the Stone Lantern (Evidence 20) being unlit. If the snow was cleaned around the lantern, maybe someone needed to access it, but since it wasn't lit, there's no reason to clean the snow. But that's a stretch.

Wait, the Hanging Scroll (Evidence 4) has Misty Fey's image obscured by gravy. Godot described her as wearing Japanese garb with Western tastes. Not sure how that's relevant.

Wait, the burnt letter (Evidence 18) is from Morgan Fey. Morgan is in confinement (Character 12), so how did she send a letter? Maybe it's related to Iris or someone else. But again, not directly conflicting with testimonies.

Let me think again. The key contradiction is between a testimony and an evidence. The most likely is Testimony 3 (torches lit, body gone) and Evidence 11 (body fell 10 ft after death). If the body fell after death, perhaps it was moved, but Maya says the body was gone. Wait, the autopsy says the body fell 10 feet after death. So the body was moved post-mortem. If the body was found in the courtyard (Crime Photo, Evidence 13), but Maya says when she came back, the body was gone, that suggests the body was moved again. But the autopsy says the body fell 10 ft after death. So perhaps the initial fall was 10 ft, but then the body was moved elsewhere. But how does that contradict the testimony?

Alternatively, Testimony 3 says the torches were lit, which would require someone to light them. If the snow had stopped, maybe the torches could be lit without being extinguished by snow. But I don't see a direct contradiction here.

Wait, let's check the Crystal Sphere (Evidence 16). It was found near Dusky Bridge with blood. It came from the victim's staff. The staff (Evidence 9) had a hidden sword used to murder Elise. The Crystal Sphere was part of the staff. If the staff was used in the Inner Temple garden (where the crime occurred), how did the Crystal Sphere end up near Dusky Bridge? That suggests the staff was taken to the bridge. But the murder happened in the garden. So maybe the killer moved the staff to the bridge, but the victim was killed in the garden. That could mean the body was moved, but the autopsy says the body fell 10 feet after death. Wait, the autopsy says the body fell after death, implying the murder happened somewhere high, like a bridge. But the crime photo (Evidence 13) is the courtyard. If the body fell from the bridge into the courtyard, but the bridge is on fire... This might be a contradiction. If the body fell from the bridge (10 ft), then the murder would have occurred on the bridge, but the crime scene is the courtyard. So maybe the body was moved from the bridge to the courtyard, but the autopsy says the body fell 10 ft after death, which would align with a bridge fall. However, the crime photo is of the courtyard. That could be a contradiction. But this involves multiple pieces of evidence and testimonies.

Alternatively, Larry's Sketch (Evidence 15) shows the bridge on fire with a silhouette. If the bridge was on fire at 10:45 PM (when lightning struck), and the body was moved from there to the courtyard, but the autopsy report's time of death is between 10-11 PM. If the murder happened on the bridge, then the body fell 10 ft into the river or something, but the crime scene is the courtyard. That might be a contradiction. But how does this relate to Maya's testimonies?

Wait, Maya's Testimony 3 says that when she returned to the garden (Inner Temple garden?), the body was gone. But the crime photo shows the courtyard where the murder occurred. If the body was in the garden and then moved, but the autopsy says it fell 10 ft after death, perhaps the initial death location was higher up (like the bridge), then the body was moved to the garden. But this is getting complicated.

Alternatively, the key contradiction is between Testimony 4 (snow cleaned around stone lantern) and the Weather Data (snow stopped at 10:50). If the snow stopped at 10:50, then any snow after that wouldn't accumulate. So if the killer cleaned the snow after 10:50, there would be no new snow to cover their tracks. But the Tracks Photo (Evidence 14) shows tracks leading to Dusky Bridge. If the tracks were made after 10:50, they would remain. However, the bridge was struck by lightning at 10:45, causing a fire. The fire lasted 30 minutes, so until around 11:15 PM. So someone could have walked to the bridge after 10:50 when the snow stopped, leaving tracks that wouldn't be covered. But how does this relate to the testimony?

Alternatively, Testimony 4 says the snow around the stone lantern was cleaned up. If the stone lantern is in the Inner Temple garden, and the snow was cleaned, but the weather data shows snow until 10:50, then cleaning the snow before 10:50 would be pointless as more snow would fall. But if cleaned after 10:50, there would be no new snow. So if Maya's Testimony 4 says the snow was cleaned up, implying it was done after the snow stopped. But the Stone Lantern (Evidence 20) wasn't lit. Maybe the contradiction is that the Stone Lantern wasn't lit, so there was no need to clean the snow around it. But if someone did clean it, perhaps they needed to use the lantern, which would require it to be lit. But the evidence says it wasn't lit. So that's a contradiction between Testimony 4 (snow cleaned around the lantern) and Evidence 20 (lantern wasn't lit). Because if the lantern wasn't lit, there's no reason to clean the snow around it, as the light wouldn't be needed. Therefore, Testimony 4 contradicts Evidence 20.

But wait, the testimony says the snow around the stone lantern was cleaned up. The stone lantern wasn't lit. So why clean the snow around an unlit lantern? Unless the killer needed to access the lantern for another reason. But according to the evidence, the lantern wasn't lit. So if the snow was cleaned, maybe the killer tried to light it but failed, or there's another reason. This could be a contradiction.

So the pair would be Testimony 4 (Maya says snow around lantern was cleaned) and Evidence 20 (Stone Lantern wasn't lit). The contradiction is that cleaning the snow around the lantern would typically be done to either light it or access it, but since it wasn't lit, there's no reason to clean the snow. Therefore, the testimony and evidence contradict each other.

cot:
Okay, let's try to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other. I need to go through each testimony and check if any of the evidence directly contradicts it.

First, looking at the testimonies provided. The testimonies are from Maya:

Testimony 0: Pearly was also stuck on the Inner Temple side that night!
Testimony 1: The next morning, she looked around, but couldn't find anyone.
Testimony 2: The next day, when the bridge was finally fixed, she was in the spare prep room.
Testimony 3: That's when Mr. Godot arrived at the Inner Temple for the first time!
Testimony 4: He found Pearly first, and cheered her right up!

Now, looking at the evidence. Let's check each testimony against the evidence.

Testimony 3 says that Godot arrived at the Inner Temple for the first time when the bridge was fixed the next day. But looking at Evidence 3, the Hazakura Temple Map, which might show the layout. Wait, maybe another evidence. Let's see Evidence 18: Burnt Letter from Morgan Fey. Or maybe Evidence 7: Weather Data. Wait, Evidence 7 mentions that lightning struck Dusky Bridge at 10:45 PM. The bridge was out that night because of the lightning. So the bridge was destroyed then. The bridge was fixed the next day, as per Testimony 2.

But Testimony 3 says that when the bridge was fixed (the next day), Godot arrived at the Inner Temple for the first time. However, if Godot was already on the Inner Temple side during the crime, that would contradict this. Wait, perhaps another evidence. Let me check Evidence 3 again. The map might show that accessing the Inner Temple requires the bridge. If the bridge was down until the next day, how did Godot get there the first time? Wait, but according to Testimony 3, Godot arrived at the Inner Temple when the bridge was fixed. But if there's evidence that Godot was already there before the bridge was fixed, that's a contradiction.

Wait, looking at Evidence 4: Hanging Scroll. The description mentions that Godot described Misty Fey's image. That suggests he was in the Inner Temple where the scroll was, perhaps before the bridge was fixed. Or maybe another evidence. Let me check the crime details. The murder happened at the Inner Temple, right? Elise's body was found there. The bridge was destroyed at 10:45 PM due to lightning. So after that, the bridge was out, meaning no one could cross from the main temple to the inner temple until it was fixed the next day. So if Godot arrived at the Inner Temple for the first time after the bridge was fixed (Testimony 3), but during the crime night, he was already there, that would be a contradiction. Wait, but how would he get there if the bridge was destroyed?

Wait, but if the bridge was destroyed at 10:45 PM, then anyone on the Inner Temple side would be stuck there until the bridge was fixed. So if Godot was on the Inner Temple side during the crime, he would have been stuck there. But Testimony 3 says he arrived at the Inner Temple for the first time the next day when the bridge was fixed. That would mean he couldn't have been there before. But maybe there's evidence that he was there during the crime. For example, if he was present at the crime scene before the bridge was fixed, that contradicts the testimony.

Looking at Evidence 17: Kurain Master's Talisman. Found in the garden of the Inner Temple, worn by Elise. If Godot was there, maybe he left something. Alternatively, maybe there's a testimony from someone else that places him there. Alternatively, the hanging scroll (Evidence 4) mentions that Godot described Misty Fey's image as being in the scroll with gravy. If he saw the scroll in the Inner Temple before the bridge was fixed, then he must have been there earlier. But according to Testimony 3, he arrived there for the first time the next day when the bridge was fixed. So that's a contradiction.

Therefore, Evidence 4 (Hanging Scroll) mentions Godot's description of Misty Fey's image, implying he saw the scroll in the Inner Temple before the bridge was fixed. But Testimony 3 claims he first arrived after the bridge was fixed. So Evidence 4 contradicts Testimony 3.
